column2:
for(i in 1:length(unique(for_RL$block))){
  ## 1. Subset original data to form block
  for_RL.b <- for_RL[for_RL$block == i, ]

  ## 2. fastLink applied to a block
  matches_FastLink <- fastLink(
    dfA = for_RL.b, dfB = for_RL.b,
    varnames = c("first_name", "last_name", "email", "age"),
    stringdist.match = c("first_name", "last_name", "email"),
    numeric.match = 'age',
    partial.match = c("first_name", "last_name", "email"),
    cut.a = 0.94, cut.p = 0.84,
    dedupe = FALSE ## this is to avoid a one-to-one match
  )
 
  ## 3. Get the data
  records.temp <- getMatches(dfA = for_RL.b,
                             dfB = for_RL.b,
                             fl.out = matches_FastLink)
 
  ## 4. Adjust the unique identifier to be block specific
  records.temp$dedupe.ids <- paste0("B", i, "_",
                                    records.temp$dedupe.ids)
  ## 5. Store the deduplicated data
  results[[i]] <- records.temp
  rm(records.temp, for_RL.b); gc() ## remove temp objects
}
If you set return.all to FALSE, you will not be able to calculate a confusion table as a summary statistic.

dfA and dfB are identical, assuming deduplication of a single data set.
Setting return.all to FALSE.
